title:
Set Estimation from Projected Multidimensional Random Variables with
  Application to a Discrete-Time Skorokhod Problem
abstract:
This paper deals with sufficient conditions on the distribution of the random
variable $H$, in the model $X =\Pi_C(H)$, for the convex hull $\widehat C_N$ of
$N$ independent copies of $X$ to be a consistent estimator - with or without
rate of convergence - of the convex body $C$. The convergence of $\widehat C_N$
is established for the Hausdorff distance under uniform conditions on the
distribution of $H$, but also in a pointwise sense under less demanding
conditions. Some of these convergence results on $\widehat C_N$ are applied to
the estimation of the time-dependent constraint set involved in a discrete-time
Skorokhod problem.
